questions.question: Bill said that he .................................. the party.
questions.description: After past reporting verbs, we use past verbs.

questions.question: I asked her ............................... she would marry me.
questions.description: We use if or whether to report questions.

questions.question: The police inspector asked us ............................... our passports.
questions.description: To report imperatives we use to-infinitives.

questions.question: I wondered how ...............................
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: The government has announced that taxes ............................
questions.description: After present reporting verbs we normally use present tenses.

questions.question: She said that she .............................. enough.
questions.description: Had had is the reported form of has/have had.

questions.question: I ............................ I didn't intend to stand for election.
questions.description: 'That' cannot be dropped after reporting verbs like reply and shout.

questions.question: I ............................................ you are probably right.
questions.description: The conjunction 'that' can be dropped after common reporting verbs like say and think.

questions.question: I .................................. I was busy.
questions.description: The conjunction 'that' cannot be dropped after the reporting verb 'shout'.

questions.question: He wanted to know ...................................... leaving.
questions.description: In indirect questions, the auxiliary verb goes after the subject.

questions.question: Nobody told me why ..................................... to sign the papers.
questions.description: The auxiliary 'do' is not used in reported questions.

questions.question: I knew how .............................
questions.description: The auxiliary 'do' is not used in reported questions and answers.
